title: Separate Gate Execution from Result Building
description:
PROBLEM: ExecuteGenTest, ExecuteGenImpl, ExecuteMultiReview (activities_enhanced.go) mix agent execution with GateResult construction. Each function does TWO things: execute logic AND build result struct.

VIOLATES: Single Responsibility Principle.

REFACTOR: Split into executeGate(ctx, params) and buildGateResult(output, gateName). Gate executors focus on logic, result builders focus on data assembly.

BENEFIT: Each function does ONE thing, easier to test, clearer separation of concerns.

title: Extract multiple file paths from output
description: TDD: Extract all FILE: entries. Returns []string with all paths found.

title: Calculate unanimous consensus (3/3)
description: TDD: Return true only if all 3 ReviewVote.Vote == APPROVE. Unanimous required.

title: Simplify BootServer Health Check Loop
description:
PROBLEM: BootServer (infra/server.go:48-112) has nested select/ticker pattern with ~8 branches. Does process setup, health checking, and cleanup in one function.

VIOLATES: SRP - server start, health verification, and error handling complected.

REFACTOR: Extract waitForHealth(ctx, baseURL, timeout) -> error. BootServer calls it after cmd.Start().

BENEFIT: Reduces BootServer complexity from 8 to 4, health check logic reusable and testable.

title: Logging for kill switch events
description: Add structured logging for all kill operations with branch IDs and reasons

title: Workflow Lifecycle
description: Implement workflow lifecycle: Bootstrap cell, main loop execution, commit on success with metadata, revert on failure, teardown with saga pattern (always runs).

title: Consolidate Activity Options Setup
description:
PROBLEM: Activity options configuration duplicated in workflows_enhanced.go (line 44), workflows_tcr.go (line 40), workflows_dag.go (line 105). Each defines identical retry policies and timeouts.

REFACTOR: Create shared function GetDefaultActivityOptions() that returns configured ActivityOptions. Workflows call it instead of inline setup.

BENEFIT: Reduces 45 lines to 15, ensures consistent retry/timeout policies across all workflows.

title: Extract File Path Matching Logic into Dedicated Package
description:
PROBLEM: Pattern matching scattered across output_parser.go (lines 201-218) and conflict/analyzer.go (lines 271-284). Different implementations of similar glob matching logic.

DUPLICATION: Two implementations of pattern overlap checking.

REFACTOR: Create pkg/patternmatch with:
- Match(path, pattern) -> bool  
- Overlap(pattern1, pattern2) -> bool
- MatchAny(path, patterns) -> bool

BENEFIT: Centralized pattern matching, consistent behavior, ~25 lines reduced.

title: Introduce Result Type to Replace Nil Checks
description:
PROBLEM: Multiple functions return (value, error) and check for nil in complex ways. Examples:
- test_parser.go returns nil for success cases
- output_parser.go checks result.Valid boolean
- conflict/analyzer.go returns nil for no conflict

INCONSISTENT: Mix of nil checks, boolean flags, and error returns.

REFACTOR: Use Result pattern with Some/None:
- type Result[T] interface with Some(T) and None
- Replace (value, nil) with Some(value)
- Replace (nil, nil) with None

BENEFIT: Explicit success/failure, eliminates ambiguous nil checks, type-safe.

BENEFIT: Eliminates 42 lines to single helper, ensures consistent cleanup behavior across all workflows.

title: Split ParseTestOutput into Focused Functions
description:
PROBLEM: ParseTestOutput (test_parser.go:72-253) has cyclomatic complexity of ~15 with nested loops, multiple regex patterns, and stateful parsing.

VIOLATES: Single Responsibility - does parsing, counting, filtering, and result building.

REFACTOR: Split into:
1. parseFailureLines(lines) - extracts failure lines
2. extractTestFailures(lines) - converts to TestFailure structs
3. countTestResults(lines) - counts pass/fail
4. buildParseResult(failures, counts) - assembles result

BENEFIT: Each function does ONE thing, complexity drops from 15 to <5 per function.

title: Extract Conflict Analysis Logic from SuggestResolution
description:
PROBLEM: SuggestResolution (conflict/analyzer.go:142-201) does 3 things: checks expiry, detects stale reservations, and logs decisions. Cyclomatic complexity of ~8.

VIOLATES: SRP - analysis, decision, and logging mixed together.

REFACTOR: Split into:
1. isExpiringSoon(holders) -> bool
2. findStaleReservations(holders) -> []Holder
3. determineResolution(expiring, stale) -> Resolution

BENEFIT: Each function has ONE job, complexity drops to <3 per function, easier to test.

title: Remove Unnecessary containsString Helper
description:
PROBLEM: containsString function in workflow/activities.go (lines 232-236) is overcomplicated and buggy. Standard library strings.Contains() does the same thing in 1 line.

CODE BLOAT: 5 lines for what should be 1.

REFACTOR: Replace all containsString(s, substr) calls with strings.Contains(s, substr).

BENEFIT: Removes 5 lines, uses well-tested standard library, eliminates potential bugs.

title: Simplify runDag Selector Loop
description:
PROBLEM: runDag function (workflows_dag.go:67-183) has cyclomatic complexity of ~12 with nested loops, selector pattern, and state machine logic. Does task scheduling, execution tracking, and failure handling.

VIOLATES: SRP - does 3 things in one function.

REFACTOR: Extract into:
1. scheduleRunnableTasks() - determines what can run
2. waitForNextCompletion() - handles selector
3. handleTaskResult() - processes success/failure

BENEFIT: Complexity drops from 12 to <5 per function, easier to understand control flow.

- getRedPhaseError(passed bool) string

title: Enhanced 6-Gate TCR Workflow with Research-Backed Multi-Review
description:
Implement a research-backed 6-gate TCR workflow with orchestrator-driven intelligence, minimal agents, and unanimous multi-review consensus.

Architecture:
- Orchestrator: All logic in Temporal workflow (prompt building, parsing, retry)
- Agents: Minimal (pure LLM, no embedded logic)
- Models: Haiku 4.5 (impl), Opus 4.5 (reviews)
- Gates: 6 total (Bootstrap, GenTest, LintTest, VerifyRED, GenImpl, VerifyGREEN, MultiReview)
- Review: Unanimous (3/3 must APPROVE) - Testing, Functional, Architecture
- Retry: Smart DAG loops back on failure with feedback
- Isolation: Worktree-based

Acceptance:
- All 110 nano-tasks completed with tests passing
- E2E test: Happy path, retry loops, unanimous review
- Documentation complete
- Zero regressions

title: Strengthen single-agent-demo integration test assertions

acceptance_criteria:
- Test fails if file cannot be read
- Test fails if content doesn't match expected
- No silent failures with t.Logf only
- Uses testify require/assert properly

title: Split ExecuteTaskWithLocks Into Focused Activities
description:
PROBLEM: ExecuteTaskWithLocks (activities_locks.go:43-72) does 4 things: acquire locks, heartbeat, execute task, release locks. Violates SRP with cyclomatic complexity of 6.

COMPLECTS: Lock management with task execution.

REFACTOR: Use composition:
- AcquireLocks activity
- ExecuteTask activity (existing)
- ReleaseLocks activity
- Workflow orchestrates the sequence

BENEFIT: Each activity does ONE thing, easier to test, better failure isolation.

title: Decompose BootstrapCell Using Builder Pattern
description:
PROBLEM: BootstrapCell (workflow/activities.go:45-105) violates SRP by doing 4 things: allocate port, create worktree, boot server, create client.

COMPLEXITY: 60 lines with nested defer cleanup logic.

COMPLECTS: Port allocation, worktree management, server lifecycle, and client creation.

REFACTOR: Use CellBuilder pattern:


Each step returns self, cleanup tracked in builder, Build() commits or rolls back.

BENEFIT: Each operation isolated, easier to test, clearer control flow.

COMPLEXITY: Each duplication is ~3 lines but scattered across 7+ locations.

title: Replace Magic Numbers with Named Constants
description:
PROBLEM: Magic numbers throughout codebase:
- server.go: 10, 200, 1, 5 (timeout values)
- activities_locks.go: 2 (minutes for lock TTL)
- conflict/analyzer.go: 5 (minutes for expiry threshold)
- workflows_dag.go: 10, 30, 1, 2, 30, 3 (timeouts and retries)

ANTI-PATTERN: Hard-coded values with no context.

REFACTOR: Create constants:
- DefaultLockTTL = 2 * time.Minute
- HealthCheckTimeout = 10 * time.Second
- ConflictExpiryThreshold = 5 * time.Minute

BENEFIT: Self-documenting code, easy to tune, consistent across codebase.

title: Document ConflictAnalyzer usage and integration
description: ConflictAnalyzer implementation is complete but lacks integration documentation. Need to document: how to use it with Agent Mail, example workflows, integration with coordinator, conflict resolution best practices.

- Create docs/CONFLICT-DETECTION.md
- Example usage with Agent Mail integration
- Conflict resolution workflow diagrams
- Add to main README.md

title: Fix single-agent-demo file verification to be strict

- Fails with error if no files created
- Reads and validates first created file
